jobs.title: Business Development Manager - Endless Commerce
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Endless Commerce

Endless Commerce is an AI-powered CommerceOS that helps consumer brands manage the chaos of omnichannel operations. We serve brands scaling from $1M to $500M+ in revenue, providing real-time inventory visibility, EDI and purchase order automation, and supply chain intelligence across DTC, wholesale, marketplaces, and retail channels.

Our clients include brands like Food52, Great Jones, Heyday, Tin Can, Pattern Brands and more-- we're growing fast and our nimble team needs your help keeping up!

The Role

You're hungry, you're scrappy, and you're ready to hustle. This role is all about getting Endless Commerce in front of the right people through outbound prospecting, event networking, and relentless follow-up. You'll send cold emails, attend conferences and dinners, follow up after demos, and generally be the face of Endless Commerce in the field.

What You'll Own

  • Send 100+ high-quality cold emails per week to qualified prospects (brand operators, COOs, founders in our target market)

  • Support our founder through demos, with follow-ups and generally do the behind-the-scenes admin of sales so that our founders can show up to meetings, nail an awesome demo, and then go back to building the product

  • Attend industry events, conferences, dinners, and networking opportunities to generate leads and build relationships

  • Follow up with all demo participants and event attendees to move them through the sales pipeline

  • Conduct initial discovery calls to qualify prospects before handing them off to sales engineers or closing reps

  • Manage outreach campaigns using Hubspot and track all interactions meticulously

  • Build relationships with prospects over time—this is a long sales cycle, so persistence and relationship-building are key

  • Provide feedback to marketing on messaging that resonates and objections you're hearing in the field

  • Hit monthly and quarterly quotas for meetings booked and qualified opportunities generated

What Success Looks Like

  • Month 1: Complete onboarding, learn the product and target customer inside and out, begin outbound prospecting

  • Month 2-3: Consistently hit activity targets (emails sent, calls made, meetings booked); begin converting meetings to qualified opportunities

  • Month 4+: Regularly exceed quota; become a trusted relationship-builder in the consumer brand community; earn meaningful commission

You're a Great Fit If

  • You have 1-3 years of sales experience (BDR, SDR, or similar roles) or are a high-energy recent grad ready to prove yourself

  • You're comfortable with rejection and can handle high-volume outbound prospecting without getting discouraged

  • You're an excellent written and verbal communicator—your cold emails get responses, and your calls get meetings

  • You love networking and aren't intimidated by walking into a room of strangers at an industry event

  • You're coachable and eager to learn—you take feedback well and constantly work to improve your craft

  • You're competitive and money-motivated—you want to earn your commission checks and are willing to put in the work

  • You understand (or can quickly learn) the consumer brand ecosystem and the operational challenges these companies face

Compensation Structure

  • Base salary: $55,000-$70,000 depending on experience

  • On-target earnings (OTE): $80,000-$100,000 with commission

  • Commission structure is designed to reward high performers significantly

  • Commission paid on qualified opportunities generated and closed deals influenced

  • Generous vacation policy and paid time off

  • Health, dental, and vision insurance

  • 401(k) with company match

  • A collaborative culture that values growth and work-life balance

Logistics

  • Full-time, remote position with travel required for events and conferences (approximately 4-6 per year)

  • Remote work between events, but expect to be on the road regularly for dinners, panels, and networking

jobs.title: Founding Engineer - Scend
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Founding Engineer - Scend

Who We Are

Scend is on a mission to modernize M&A and bring efficiency to private markets. With a strong team, early customers, and backing from top investors like Pear VC, we’re positioned for rapid growth.

You’ll join a lean, high-impact team who share a passion for building beautiful, functional products. Our team brings deep expertise across tech and finance: with backgrounds spanning M&A, private equity, consumer fintech, and the Python open-source community.

Our Values (DEAL)

  1. Deliver: Everyone ships code, designs features, or works directly with customers to turn ideas into products.

  2. Empower: We are more than our job titles. If you see a problem or an opportunity, you’re empowered to take action.

  3. Align: We solve problems together, openly and with humility.

  4. Learn: We’re always exploring new ideas, tools, and ways of working.

The Role

You’ll work directly with our founders to shape the product and architecture from the ground up. As an early team member, you’ll have an outsized impact on everything from system design to our engineering culture. While prior experience is not required, a background or interest in LLMs and Machine Learning is a big plus. 

Responsibilities

  • Design & Build: Architect scalable, high-performance APIs to serve financial data and turn them into product features

  • AI-Powered Systems: Generate datasets and research reports using LLMs; applying evals and fine-tuning to drive accuracy

  • Data Processing: Process large datasets using Airflow, Pandas, and Spark

  • Web Crawling: Develop high-scale systems for crawling sites and docs from the web

  • Infrastructure: Manage infrastructure with Terraform, Docker, AWS ECS, and monitoring tools like Sentry and CloudWatch

Requirements

  • 2+ years building scalable software systems

  • Expertise in Python and SQL

  • Plus: Comfortable with data processing frameworks (Airflow, Pandas, Spark)

  • Plus: Familiarity with infra automation tools (Terraform, Docker)

  • Plus: Background in LLM systems and Machine Learning

Perks & Benefits

*If you’d like to add a perk, let us know! As a founding team member, you’ll play a key role in shaping our culture.

  • Competitive Compensation & Equity: You’ll have a meaningful stake in our success.

  • Healthcare: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage.

  • Flexible Environment: We’re based in NYC and value in-person collaboration, but we’re open to remote arrangements for exceptional talent

  • Early Team Influence: Your input will shape our product, culture, and future.

  • Growth & Culture: We invest in your growth (courses, books, conferences) and regularly host team events, offsites, and socials to build our team culture. 

  • Unlimited PTO

jobs.title: Founding Account Executive (UK) — Phaselab
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Founding Account Executive – Phaselab 🚀

Location: London

Type: Full-time

Salary: Competitive, with equity options

About Phaselab

Phaselab is rebuilding the legacy eDiscovery industry from the ground up, empowering in-house legal teams with tools for document production that bypass the existing labor-heavy approach. We're Seed stage but are already working with Fortune 500 companies and are scaling rapidly.

The Role

We’re looking for a Founding Account Executive to help us build and scale our sales motion in the UK and Europe, where we already have dozens of customers and significant new pipeline. You’ll report directly to our CEO and work closely with our entire team to grow our rapidly-expanding business in Europe. This is a high-ownership, high-impact, high-growth role where you’ll directly shape the future of the business and will have the opportunity to build our sales strategy and culture.

What You’ll Do

  • Own the sales cycle from prospecting to closing deals

  • Build and maintain pipeline through outbound prospecting, events, and inbound lead qualification

  • Contribute to the development of our sales playbook, helping identify what works and refining our approach

  • Work closely with founders to provide market feedback and customer insights

What We’re Looking For

  • Full sales cycle ownership: You have experience building pipeline and taking deals from prospect to closed-won.

  • Industry expertise: Demonstrated success in the legal tech, privacy tech, or eDiscovery space.

  • Extreme ownership and attention to detail. You’re a person who never drops balls.

  • Very strong written and oral communication skills.

  • A bias for action: You ship fast and iterate based on feedback.

Why Join Us?

  • Impact: Your work will directly shape the future of the company.

  • Growth: High ownership, deep collaboration with company leadership and customers. Potential to grow into new roles and scopes as the company grows.

  • Speed: We move fast, ship often, and value autonomy.

  • Culture: Our team is kind, collaborative, inquisitive, and inclusive – and we want to keep it that way. We have high standards for quality and ethics, and help each other learn in order to reach our objectives. We think technology is best built by teams with a diversity of background, thought, and experience.

👒 Every team member is a human first, and we strive to create a culture and environment that supports your career goals and respects all of the hats you wear in life, not just the ones that earn you a paycheck.

Our Team

We were founded in 2023 by SaaS and data experts: Josh (CEO) lead Chartbeat as CTO to $70M+ ARR and exit; David (COO and Head of Product) lead Cortico (MIT spinoff) from 0->1 as COO; Paul (CTO) ran search infrastructure at Reddit and was engineer #7 at Moat (acquired by Oracle for $850M).

jobs.title: Forward Deployed Engineer - Resiquant AI
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

At ResiQuant, we're tackling one of the biggest challenges in disaster resilience: the lack of accurate, standardized, and dynamic property data. In a world increasingly impacted by climate change and natural disasters like earthquakes, hurricanes, and wildfires, decisions about risk are often made with incomplete or incorrect information.

Our mission is to empower insurers, financial institutions, and asset managers with AI systems fused with structural engineering expertise. These systems bridge critical data gaps to deliver precise, actionable building insights for better decision-making.

Founded by Stanford PhDs, we are committed to leveraging cutting-edge AI to protect communities and businesses from disaster impacts. At ResiQuant, we're building a future where every organization has access to world-class property risk intelligence to drive resilience and safeguard what matters most.

The Role

You’ll be the technical bridge to enterprise insurance customers, owning the journey from initial technical discovery through full-scale integration. As our first forward deployed engineer, you’ll work directly with underwriters, executives, and IT teams at top-tier carriers to implement AI solutions that transform how trillion-dollar portfolios assess wildfire, earthquake, and hurricane risks. Your work will directly shape customer adoption, product direction, and the resilience of businesses and communities worldwide.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead technical discovery: shadow underwriters, map workflows, and identify integration opportunities.

  • Architect and implement custom integrations, APIs, and automations that connect customer systems to ResiQuant’s platform.

  • Travel weekly to customer sites across the U.S. to run workshops, lead deployments, and ensure adoption.

  • Train and onboard underwriters, ensuring teams successfully integrate the platform into daily workflows.

  • Serve as the voice of the customer — translating real-world needs into product priorities and roadmap direction.

  • Build AI-powered internal tools that streamline implementations and scale customer delivery.

  • Partner directly with founders to shape strategy and ensure customer success.

Who You Are

  • 3–5 years of software engineering experience with strong foundations in APIs, integrations, and full-stack development.

  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent technical background.

  • Exceptional communication and customer empathy — able to explain complex systems to both executives and technical teams.

  • Analytical problem-solver who can abstract business processes into technical specifications.

  • Comfortable traveling extensively and working on-site with customers.

  • Thrive in a fast-paced, high-ownership startup environment.

Nice to Have

  • Prior experience in enterprise deployments, technical consulting, or customer-facing engineering.

  • Familiarity with insurance workflows or financial risk systems.

  • Experience building internal automation or AI-powered productivity tools.

Why Join Us

  • Founding Impact: Be the first forward deployed engineer and shape how we engage customers.

  • Growth: Work directly with customers, founders, and engineering teams — accelerating both technical and business skills.

  • Innovation: Implement AI systems that merge structural engineering, climate science, and financial risk.

  • Mission: Drive real-world resilience for businesses and communities facing climate change.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary + meaningful equity.

  • Full medical, dental, and vision benefits.

  • 401(k) with company match.

  • Daily lunch + commute support in our SF office.

  • Fast-paced, mission-driven culture with travel and direct customer exposure.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Founding Product Engineer – Phaselab

Location: New York or Raleigh/Durham Area

Type: Full-time

Salary: Competitive, with equity options

About Phaselab

Phaselab is rebuilding the legacy eDiscovery industry from the ground up, empowering in-house legal teams with tools for document production that bypass the existing services-heavy approach. We're Seed stage but are already working with Fortune 500 companies and are scaling rapidly.

The Role

We’re looking for a Product Engineer to help us build and scale our core product. You’ll work closely with our Founders and the rest of the Engineering team to ship impactful features and improve performance across the stack. This is a high-ownership, high-impact role where you’ll directly shape the future of Phaselab’s technology.

What You’ll Do

First Week

  • Get onboarded, set up your dev environment, and dive into our systems.

  • Ship a small update or bug fix to get familiar with the codebase.

  • Use the product to understand how it works and identify areas for improvement.

First Month

  • Ship two major features

By 90 Days

  • Ship product updates daily/weekly with a strong focus on quality.

  • Collaborate closely with the team and our customers to shape the future of the product.

What We’re Looking For

  • 3+ years of experience in full-stack development, ideally with startups or fast-moving teams.

  • Strong expertise in Next.js, React, and Tailwind for frontend development.

  • Familiarity in Python for backend/API development.

  • Familiarity with Terraform, Kubernetes (K8s), and Postgres for infrastructure and data management.

  • Experience optimizing web performance and improving frontend UX.

  • A bias for action: You ship fast and iterate based on feedback.

  • Strong product and design sense: You think beyond the code and care about delivering an exceptional user experience.

  • Extreme ownership: You're excited to make a mark and you make sure balls don't get dropped.

Why Join Us?

  • Impact: Your work will directly shape the product and the future of the company.

  • Growth: High ownership, deep collaboration with company and technical leadership.

  • Speed: We move fast, ship often, and value autonomy.

  • Culture: Our team is kind, collaborative, inquisitive, and inclusive – and we want to keep it that way. We have high standards for quality and ethics, and help each other learn in order to reach our objectives. jobs.title: Founding Team – Ops & GTM
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🚀 Founding Operations

Spur is transforming the software testing landscape—powered by AI and driven by a relentless commitment to delighting customers. Founded by Yale alums with backgrounds from Figma and DeepMind, and backed by leading investors including Y Combinator, First Round Capital, Neo, Pear VC, and Conviction, Spur is reimagining QA from first principles. We’re already enabling some of the fastest-growing engineering teams in the world to accelerate their pace and enhance their user experience.

As our first Operations hire, you'll work directly with our CEO and co-founders, taking ownership of high-impact projects across marketing, sales, and go-to-market (GTM) strategy. This is a high-visibility, high-growth opportunity to get in early and shape how Spur operates day-to-day—while learning what it takes to build a fast-growing startup from scratch.

✨ What You'll Do

  • Own and amplify Spur’s voice: Manage and grow our LinkedIn and Twitter presence, crafting engaging narratives that resonate deeply with our audiences.

  • Help execute GTM strategy: Partner closely with the CEO to operationalize strategic initiatives and track progress across customer acquisition efforts.

  • Support sales pipeline: Source, qualify, and nurture high-value leads, helping Spur convert interest into impact.

  • Run ops behind the scenes: Plan events, coordinate logistics, and ensure Spur shows up with polish—whether at a major conference or a cozy dinner.

  • Build collateral: Work with the design team to develop sales decks, marketing one-pagers, and internal docs that keep the team aligned.

🌟 You're Perfect for this Role If You:

  • Thrive in ambiguity: You love the challenge of building something new and are comfortable navigating through uncharted territory.

jobs.title: Founding Engineer - Abacus
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Abacus

Abacus is reinventing how accounting firms operate by building AI agents that automate the tedious, repetitive workflows that teams currently face. Our core engine combines advanced OCR and LLMs to deliver truly intelligent back-office automation. We're already working with large enterprise clients, generating meaningful revenue, and backed by top-tier investors. We’ve accomplished all of this as a team of two, and we’re excited to grow our team. If you want to shape the future of AI-powered operations and own meaningful technical work from day one, this is the place.

The Role

We're hiring our first Founding Engineer to own and expand the core machine learning engine behind Abacus. You’ll report directly to the co-founders and work in person from our NYC office. This is a rare opportunity to join a high-growth company as an early engineer with massive autonomy and influence over product and technical direction.

In your first 3–6 months, you’ll:

  • Improve and scale our ML extraction engine using LLMs and OCR

  • Own backend architecture and infrastructure decisions

  • Build and ship greenfield features to expand the workflows we automate

Over the next year, you'll help lay the groundwork for our engineering org as we scale, while staying hands-on and focused on impact.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead development of our ML-powered document extraction engine

  • Architect backend systems with performance and scalability in mind

  • Build and deploy new automation features for tax firms

  • Collaborate closely with the founders on product and user needs

  • Help define our engineering culture and technical roadmap

What We're Looking For

Must-haves:

  • 1–5 years of experience, ideally in high-ownership or early-stage environments

  • Strong backend development skills, particularly in Python

  • Proven 0→1 builder (side projects, startup experience, or both)

  • Willingness to work from our NYC office, 5 days/week

  • Willingness to complete a technical take-home exercise as part of the process

Nice-to-haves:

  • Experience with LLMs, OCR, or data extraction systems

  • Exposure to AI infrastructure or evaluation frameworks

Why Join Us

  • No ceiling on ownership or growth

  • Significant equity and high-leverage role at a fast-growing startup

  • Top-tier health insurance, daily lunches, and an in-office barista

  • You’ll help define the trajectory of the product, team, and company!

jobs.title: Operations Lead - Anchor AI
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us

Global trade still runs on outdated, time-consuming manual workflows. We’re fixing that! Anchor AI is building AI agents for customs brokers. Our AI works alongside humans to help brokers process more shipments- faster, with fewer errors.

We’re growing fast, backed by First Round Capital (early investors in Flexport), Pear VC, and other top investors. The timing is perfect: with the changes from the current administration, the market is waking up to the potential of AI. We’re racing to be the default AI platform for them.

About the role

We’re hiring an Operations Lead to help scale our business faster and smarter. You’ll work across sales, growth, people, and internal ops to build the backbone that keeps the company running efficiently as we grow.

This role is about unlocking leverage—bringing structure to what’s working, fixing what’s not, and spotting opportunities to improve how we operate. You might streamline our CRM workflows to support sales, refine onboarding to ramp new hires faster, or implement lightweight systems that keep our team coordinated and productive.

You’ll be a cross-functional partner to leadership, trusted to handle high-priority projects and build the operational muscle that powers our next phase of growth. If you love solving messy problems, wearing lots of hats, and making things work better—this role is for you.

What You’ll Do:

  • Sales & Growth Enablement: Support revenue-driving teams by streamlining sales workflows, maintaining CRM hygiene, coordinating follow-ups, and making sure we have the right tools and data to close deals faster.

  • Events & Conferences: Help us show up strong at the right industry events—own logistics, travel coordination, and event prep (e.g. decks, collateral, lead capture).

  • People & Admin: Run the new hire checklist, manage onboarding/offboarding, coordinate IT setup, route basic AP/AR, and keep HR systems running smoothly.

  • Tooling & Data Ops: Own the structure and upkeep of our internal Notion, Google Drive, and HubSpot to ensure the team has access to what they need, when they need it.

  • Special Projects: Jump into high-priority or ambiguous needs—whether that’s building an internal dashboard, operationalizing a new process, or generating AI-powered sales collateral.

We’re Looking For Someone Who:

  • Has 3–7 years of experience in a generalist operations role at an early-stage B2B SaaS or marketplace startup.

  • Has owned complex, cross-functional projects—like spinning up internal systems, supporting sales teams, or managing multi-stakeholder vendor rollouts.

  • Is comfortable with tools like Google Workspace, Notion or Airtable, Zapier, and HubSpot (or a similar CRM).

  • Has a bias for action—you default to solving problems, not scheduling meetings about them.

  • Thrives in ambiguity and self-teaches quickly; you don’t need a playbook handed to you—you’ll write the first version.

  • Has a customer-first mindset, and is happy to jump into high-priority needs, even if they’re outside your lane.

  • Brings a low-ego, high-ownership attitude—you’re just as willing to book flights or build a dashboard as you are to drive strategy.

  • Communicates clearly and professionally—your written updates could be sent to an investor without edits.

Why This Role?

This is a rare chance to step into a high-leverage role early in the company’s lifecycle. You’ll have full ownership of operations while working directly with the founder and product team—and your work will directly impact revenue, customer satisfaction, and scale.

jobs.title: Growth Lead - Brico
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Brico

Brico is setting the new standard in financial licensing—removing barriers to innovation while raising the bar on regulatory excellence. We’re building the first AI-native platform designed to help fintechs apply for and maintain complex financial licenses—like money transmitter and lending licenses—across all 50 states.

Until now, this process has been painfully manual and expensive, dominated by consultants billing by the hour. Brico changes that. Our platform automates the most repetitive and error-prone parts of licensing using smart data mapping, intelligent workflows, and purpose-built infrastructure. What can’t be automated is handled by our exceptional in-house team of licensing experts.

The result? Customers say Brico makes license applications 5x faster and reduces ongoing license maintenance work by 75%.

Brico has been named one of Forbes’ Top 50 Fintechs, recognized alongside industry giants like Stripe and Chime—all while at the Seed stage. We’re growing fast and our GTM team is pouring gasoline on an already-burning fire. If you’re excited about reshaping the regulatory landscape for financial services, we’d love to meet you.

About the Role

Brico is hiring the second member of our GTM team. If you love rolling up your sleeves, experimenting across sales and marketing, and building systems from the ground up, you’ll thrive here. This is a true builder role. You’ll be wearing sales, marketing, ops, and strategy hats, all while helping define our GTM playbook from scratch.

What You’ll Do

  • Be a thought partner on all things GTM—from pricing to positioning to pitch, working closely with the Head of GTM and CEO

  • Refine our ICP and continuously iterate on our marketing strategy/channels based on market feedback

  • Test paid marketing campaigns to identify scalable acquisition channels

  • Help drive our content marketing strategy, including blog, email, and social

  • Organize events, both virtual and in-person, to grow awareness and drive pipeline

  • Strategize on increasing sales velocity

  • Evaluate, implement and optimize GTM tools, including Hubspot, to scale our efforts and build the right tech stack

  • Build prospect lists and run outbound tests to inform our broader sales motion

  • Create and optimize sales collateral that converts

  • Research GTM best practices from top SaaS and fintech companies

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (prod-eng, compliance, ops) to ensure GTM and client success are tightly aligned

You Might Be a Fit If You…

  • Have 5-10 years of experience in marketing experience at a B2B startup

  • Are obsessed with experimentation, testing, and iteration

  • Grit is your middle name—you know how to do a lot with a little

  • Are a strong communicator and writer who’s comfortable creating materials that inspire action

  • Think like an operator: You don’t just have ideas, you implement them (and use AI whenever possible to drive efficiency)

  • Thrive in ambiguity and want a front-row seat to how a high-growth startup is built

  • Are hungry to learn and grow fast—and love collaborating across functions

  • Design skills is a plus

  • Prior fintech experience is a plus

Why Join Brico Now?

  • Work alongside a small, elite team tackling one of fintech’s thorniest problems

  • Be part of a company with real traction—early-stage growth with massive market pull

  • Own huge pieces of the GTM function and help define our playbook

  • Join a Forbes Top 50 Fintech, pre-Series A

  • Make your mark early and grow as the company grows

Let’s build the future of regtech—together.
Apply now or reach out directly to molly@brico.ai with your LinkedIn and a few words about why this role is a fit.

jobs.title: Finance Manager - Pear
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who we are:

Pear VC is an early stage venture firm based in Menlo Park with offices in San Francisco and Menlo Park. We’re specialists in pre-seed and seed and partner with founders at the earliest stages to turn great ideas into category-defining companies.

Our team is composed of a deep bench of experts and operators. We’ve founded 10+ companies and seeded startups now worth over $50B. We have a team with operational experience across recruiting, sales and marketing to help our founders build companies from the ground up. Our track record is strong: in just 9 years, we have seeded 7 companies currently valued over $1B (including Branch Metrics, Gusto, Aurora Solar, and Viz.ai) and 3 public companies (DoorDash, Guardant Health, and Senti Bio).

What you’ll do:

As Finance Manager, you will work directly with the CFO, supporting fund and management company accounting, and compliance, as well as a number of other organizational tasks/projects. This is an exciting opportunity to get exposure to the many aspects of venture capital firm’s functions, incl. fund & firm accounting, post-investment processes, and back office functionality. The ideal candidate wants more exposure to the larger back office department of a venture fund rather than focusing on one small area of accounting.

In this role, you will:

  • Oversee fund related processes such as maintaining our internal system for investment rounds, exits, cap table changes; track fund related expenses and rebills; prepare materials for the quarterly & annual valuation & reporting processes;

  • Handle management company processes across AR/AP; expense classification, allocation, reimbursement & tracking; operating budget

  • Support LP related communications, initiatives, and incoming requests, including fundraising prep & ODD support

  • Support compliance activities within the firm, incl. filings & recordkeeping

  • Tackle ad-hoc projects incl. periodic review of vendors & software in place; annual business license/insurance/tax renewals

What you’ll bring:

  • Understanding of US GAAP accounting principles and partnership accounting

  • Experience at a VC firm, fund admin, or tax/audit firm

  • Strong work ethic and high attention to detail

  • Excellent time management skills & problem-solving mentality

  • Ability to easily context switch between multiple ongoing projects

  • Strong follow-through on outstanding tasks

  • Can-do attitude in a lean, growing team-oriented environment

The expected base pay range for this position in the SF Bay Area is $135,000‐$185,000/year; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job‐related knowledge, skills, and experience. Base pay information is based on market location and is not inclusive of discretionary bonuses or other benefits offered by the company.

First Principles – We start from truth, not tradition, and solve problems in original ways.

Ownership – What you work on is yours to elevate; we take accountability and act with confidence.

Relentlessness – We finish what we start, turning obstacles into breakthroughs.

Customer First – Every decision is measured by one standard: does this make our customers’ lives easier?

Empathy – We respect differing perspectives, design for human needs, and build trust that lasts.

  • Work directly with founders on roadmap and strategy.

  • Collaborate with enterprise and startup partners to deliver impact.

  • Drive execution in a high-ownership, high-leverage role.

  • Startup experience leading significant projects.

  • 100% health, dental, and vision coverage.

  • Hybrid schedule - in-office 3 days a week.

  • Unlimited PTO.

jobs.title: Founding AE
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About August

August is building the future of legal work. Our agentic AI transforms how lawyers retrieve knowledge, reason through documents, and automate complex workflows — giving legal teams a massive edge.

We’re a high-energy team backed by Tier 1 VCs. In just a few months, we’ve landed law firms and have seen 4x growth last quarter— and we’re growing fast.

Founded by alumni of Wachtell Lipton, Blackstone, DoorDash, Columbia, and NYU Law, we’re in the earliest innings of a generational shift. Join us and help redefine how legal work gets done.

The Opportunity

We’re looking for a Founding Account Executive who is excited to own our sales motion from the ground up. You’ll work directly with the founders, engage some of the most forward-looking law firms, and help shape how AI is adopted across the legal industry.

You’ll need to be comfortable leading complex sales cycles, deeply understanding customer workflows, and translating technical capabilities into business value. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-moving environment, loves building new markets, and is energized by high ownership.

What You'll Do

  • Own the full sales cycle: Prospect, qualify, pitch, negotiate, and close new customers.

  • Drive revenue growth: Meet and exceed sales targets across mid-market and enterprise law firms.

  • Be the face of August: Represent us at industry events, conferences, and key client meetings.

  • Partner with Product: Gather feedback from prospects and customers to inform our product roadmap.

  • Refine the Playbook: Build the repeatable sales processes that future AEs will scale.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally: Work closely with legal, engineering, and leadership teams to customize solutions and ensure customer success.

About You

  • 2–5 years of experience in a closing sales role (SaaS, Legal Tech, or B2B Enterprise preferred).

  • Track record of consistently exceeding quota and owning complex, multi-threaded sales.

  • Strong consultative sales skills — you can dig into a prospect’s problems, not just pitch features.

  • Comfort navigating technical conversations and translating value for non-technical buyers.

  • Ability to thrive in ambiguity and adapt quickly as we scale.

  • Bonus: Experience selling into legal, professional services, or highly regulated industries.

  • Bonus: JD or prior legal industry experience.

Why Join August

  • Founding Impact: Shape not just your role but the company.

  • Uncapped Upside: Competitive base + commission, early equity ownership.

  • Top-tier Team: Work alongside people who move fast, think clearly, and care deeply.

  • Category-Defining Work: Help build the first true AI agents for the legal profession.

  • Fast Growth: Scale your career as we scale the company.

Referral Bonus

Know someone who would be a good fit? Connect them with rutvik@vecflow.ai. If we hire them and they stay on for 90 days you’ll get a $5,000 referral bonus and August merch!

Welcome to Matter, where we are not just observing our Earth; we are understanding all matter around us in ways that have never been possible before.

jobs.title: Member of Technical Staff - Outspeed
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us
Outspeed is solving one of the biggest challenges with current AI systems - latency. We are building the infra for real-time AI for applications in gaming, AR/VR, robotics, and more.

Outspeed is led by an experienced team of researchers and engineers with collective experience from MIT, Google, and Microsoft. Our team is based in San Francisco and values empathy, deep technical knowledge, and autonomy. 

Janak earned his bachelor's and master's degrees from MIT and built grid-scale AI algorithms and infra at Autogrid (acq. Schneider). Sahil is a published researcher who led AI infra efforts at Google and Microsoft.

Role Description
As an early Member of Technical Staff you’ll dive into every layer of Outspeed’s real-time AI platform—core inference engines, orchestration services, developer APIs, and customer-facing tools. You’ll alternate between rapid prototyping and hardening production systems, shipping code that is immediately exercised by teams around the world.

Typical weeks might include:

  • Owning end-to-end feature work—from RFC and design review to infrastructure-as-code, monitoring, and post-launch iteration.

  • Optimizing GPU inference pipelines, extending our TypeScript/React console, and designing a new audio-streaming protocols.

  • Pairing with customers to debug latency spikes, then upstreaming the fix into our orchestration layer.

  • Influencing engineering culture: instituting best practices, mentoring newer hires, and shaping our technical roadmap alongside the founders.

This role is perfect for an engineer who enjoys breadth, thrives on context-switching, and wants their fingerprints on everything we build.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary + Equity

  • Health, dental, and vision insurance.

  • Bonuses based on performance

  • We are a company founded by immigrants, and we are committed to providing support to immigrant workers throughout their journey.

Requirements

  • 2+ years of professional software engineering, with deep proficiency in at least one systems language (Go/Rust/C++) and one high-level language (Python/TypeScript).

  • Proven track record shipping production-grade distributed systems—you’ve designed, implemented, and operated services that run at scale and stay up.

  • Hands-on experience with end-to-end ML workflows: data pipelines, model training/tuning, packaging, and low-latency serving (PyTorch + CUDA or similar).

  • Strong product sense and the ability to translate ambiguous problems into well-scoped engineering work.

  • Excellent written & verbal communication; comfortable leading design docs and code reviews in a fast-moving, asynchronous environment.

Nice-to-haves

  • Expertise running containerized workloads with Docker, Kubernetes, or Nomad, plus IaC with Terraform or Pulumi.

  • Knowledge of public-cloud primitives (SDN, block storage, secrets/identity, spot fleet management) and how to squeeze every dollar out of them.

  • Familiarity with modern inference tooling (e.g., vLLM, Ray, Triton, llama.cpp) and a solid mental model of GPU/TPU performance bottlenecks.

  • A history of thriving in early-stage startups: rapid iteration, “build → measure → learn” loops, and wearing multiple hats at once.

You’ll alternate between rapid prototyping and hardening production systems, shipping code that is immediately exercised by teams around the world.

Typical weeks might include:

 - Owning end-to-end feature work—from RFC and design review to infrastructure-as-code, monitoring, and post-launch iteration.

 - Optimizing GPU inference pipelines, extending our TypeScript/React console, and designing a new audio-streaming protocols.

 - Pairing with customers to debug latency spikes, then upstreaming the fix into our orchestration layer.

 - Influencing engineering culture: instituting best practices, mentoring newer hires, and shaping our technical roadmap alongside the founders.

This role is perfect for an engineer who enjoys breadth, thrives on context-switching, and wants their fingerprints on everything we build.

Benefits

 - Competitive salary + Equity

 - Health, dental, and vision insurance.

 - Bonuses based on performance

 - We are a company founded by immigrants, and we are committed to providing support to immigrant workers throughout their journey.

Requirements

 - 2+ years of professional software engineering, with deep proficiency in at least one systems language (Go/Rust/C++) and one high-level language (Python/TypeScript).

 - Proven track record shipping production-grade distributed systems—you’ve designed, implemented, and operated services that run at scale and stay up.

 - Hands-on experience with end-to-end ML workflows: data pipelines, model training/tuning, packaging, and low-latency serving (PyTorch + CUDA or similar).

 - Strong product sense and the ability to translate ambiguous problems into well-scoped engineering work.

 - Excellent written & verbal communication; comfortable leading design docs and code reviews in a fast-moving, asynchronous environment.

Nice-to-haves

 - Expertise running containerized workloads with Docker, Kubernetes, or Nomad, plus IaC with Terraform or Pulumi.

 - Knowledge of public-cloud primitives (SDN, block storage, secrets/identity, spot fleet management) and how to squeeze every dollar out of them.

 - Familiarity with modern inference tooling (e.g., vLLM, Ray, Triton, llama.cpp) and a solid mental model of GPU/TPU performance bottlenecks.

 - A history of thriving in early-stage startups: rapid iteration, “build → measure → learn” loops, and wearing multiple hats at once.

jobs.title: AI Engineer Intern
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Tanagram:

Tanagram's mission is to enable developers to work at the speed of thought. To do that, we're building a tool that captures hard-won lessons buried in codebases, code reviews, incident post-mortems, and Slack chats. We turn those lessons into real-time guardrails that flag or fix risky patterns the moment they reach a pull request — and, eventually, at code generation time — so that engineers can ship faster and avoid disaster.

Imagine an ideal staff engineer. They know the entire codebase and how different systems interact. They follow every PR, so they know what changes are being made and how patterns evolve. They've read all the documentation. They keep up-to-date on Slack conversations. Ultimately, they index all that information in their heads, and deliver impact by showing up everywhere and saying the right things at the right time.

We're building that, but at scale for entire teams and companies. Tanagram is an extension of every team's best staff engineer, available anywhere and anytime.

About This Role:

As an AI Engineer Intern, you'll bridge the gap between AI research and application by using the latest research and models to build our product. Our product, so far, is almost entirely backend. We mostly build in Python, with some Swift for CPU-bound operations.

We’re a small team of generalists and work across multiple domains. We're looking for meticulous, high-agency people who have the skills (or learning ability) to solve problems expediently, and an understanding of the appropriate quality bar given the surrounding business context.

We will generally work in-person in San Francisco (our office is in Mission Bay) or New York.

What You Might Do:

  • Talk directly to users: understand their requirements, ask for their feedback, follow up as needed, and iterate based on what they say.

  • Evaluate and build with the best tools in an AI agentic stack: LLM-Evals, Guardrails for AI, CodeAct (agents writing code), memory for agents (like Mem0).

  • Build services to ingest data from places like Github, Slack, and Confluence.

  • Deploy & use reasoning models like Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct.

  • Eagerly identify and implement improvements to our core foundations (e.g. clearing performance bottlenecks for scalability).

  • Ensure that systems are efficient, maintainable, and well-monitored.

What We Offer:

  • Challenging work with the latest advances in LLM techniques.

  • Top-of-market compensation.

  • Computer/office equipment stipend.

  • Food stipend/reimbursements on meals.

  • A relatively un-chaotic working environment (we aren't pivoting every week).

  • An opportunity to help define our company.

Qualifications:

  • Hands-on experience building with LLMs, with a strong intuition for what models can do and how to get the best results out of them.

  • Well-crafted (i.e. generally reliable; tastefully designed) work examples.

  • Bonus points:

    • Experience working on parsers and compilers (e.g. LLVM; Typescript), type systems (e.g. Sorbet), or VSCode or IntelliJ itself.

    • Experience with search and/or indexing technologies.

    • If you've previously worked at a startup, or founded one yourself.

Compensation:

Depending on the relevance and amount of your experience, the salary for this position ranges from $6,900 to $11,000 per month.

jobs.title: Sales Development Rep - OnRamp
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About OnRamp

We’re on a mission to redefine B2B customer onboarding.

OnRamp is helping businesses onboard and activate their customers faster and more efficiently. Our software makes it simple to guide customers step by step, keeping them engaged from day one, delivering value early, and setting the stage for long-term success. If you’re ready to help companies work smarter, improve customer outcomes, and create raving fans, we’d love to chat.

We've been working on this since 2019, and have customers like Anheuser-Busch, Cardinal Health, CommerceIQ, HHA Exchange and many more who are on this journey with us. Today, we're growing fast and excited for new teammates to join us who are the best at what they do.

OnRamp’s sales team is in the office 5 days a week in our Boston, MA HQ.

About The Role

We're seeking a motivated Sales Development Representative with an entrepreneurial spirit to join our founding Sales team! As an early team member, you'll be instrumental in helping define our sales motion, meaningfully shape our future product, and drive business revenue, all while having a blast doing it!

What You'll Achieve

  • Prospect and develop new potential accounts by educating contacts about how they can increase their team's collaboration, transparency, and productivity with OnRamp

  • Work closely with Marketing to experiment with different audiences, messaging, and channels to generate opportunities

  • Reach out to prospects via email, phone, and LinkedIn to educate them on our product/service

  • Hold face-to-face and Zoom meetings with prospective customers to understand their business challenges and goals

  • Hold ownership over pipeline generation tactics and strategic approaches

  • Collaborate and influence on performance initiatives, product launches, and service innovation when working with cross-functional partners

    • Work with our Marketing team to build strong program feedback loops

    • Work with our GTM team to hit revenue & pipeline generation targets

Skills And Toolset You'll Need To Bring

  • Although previous sales development experience is a plus, we are open to all levels of experience. If you think you have what it takes, please apply!

  • Engaging and compelling customer skills - high cognitive empathy and ability to craft stories tailored to the customer

  • An ability to operate within the gray and find creative or out-of-the-box solutions when faced with ambiguity

  • A track record of high achievement in current and previous roles hitting or exceeding quotas

  • A builders mentality who thrives in collaborative environments

  • A tireless positive attitude with strong grit, especially when navigating uncharted territories

  • A growth mindset and view challenges as learning opportunities, not failures

  • A passion for customers and a natural empathy for their needs

  • A love for getting to know new people and helping them solve their business problems

  • Patience, warmth, and organization

  • You are energized to be part of the building phase for the revenue team in a fast-growing company

  • You LOVE talking to customers; Always interested in digging deeper and learning more

  • You are a phenomenally strong communicator.

  • You can put yourself in others’ shoes and see situations from perspectives other than your own

  • You’re hardworking and goal-oriented

We hire talented and passionate people from a variety of backgrounds because we want our employee base to represent the wide diversity of our customers we have. If you’re excited about a role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every bullet point listed in the job description, we still encourage you to apply. If you’re a builder at heart, share our company values, and enthusiastic about making software toolmaking ubiquitous, we want to hear from you.

OnRamp is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. OnRamp considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. OnRamp is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please don’t hesitate to let us know.

OnRamp is committed to providing highly competitive cash compensation, equity, and benefits. The compensation offered for this role will be based on multiple factors such as location, the role’s scope and complexity, and the candidate’s experience and expertise.

jobs.title: Engineering Fellow - Pear VC
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Pear VC

Pear VC is an early-stage venture capital firm that works with founders at the very beginning—before there’s a team, before there’s revenue, sometimes even before there’s a product. We’ve partnered with 10+ companies we’ve founded ourselves, and backed startups now worth over $50B - including 7 unicorns and 3 public companies in just 9 years.

Our team is made up of former founders and operators who know what it takes to go from idea → product → company.

Why This Fellowship is Different

This is not a traditional “internship.”

As our engineering fellow, you’ll be building tools, automations, and products that will be used by:

  • Our portfolio founders - helping them launch, grow, and scale faster.

  • Our investment and platform teams - making them more effective in supporting startups.

You’ll work side-by-side with early-stage founders, see how different startups operate, and understand the challenges they face. This is a chance to see the startup journey up close - and to decide if building your own company might be in your future.

What You’ll Do

  • Identify opportunities to save founders and investors time through better tools and automation.

  • Translate needs into simple, impactful workflows.

  • Build solutions that work with minimal maintenance overhead.

  • Choose the right approach: buy existing software, use low-code/no-code tools, or build from scratch.

Who We’re Looking For

We’re looking for a builder who is:

  • A sophomore or junior in computer science, engineering, or a related field.

  • Comfortable with at least one programming language (Python or JavaScript).

  • Curious about startups and enjoys learning about how companies grow from the ground up.

  • A creative problem solver who can work independently and ship quickly.

  • Excited to work in a fast-paced, small-team environment where your work will have immediate impact.

  • Able to spend ~10 hours per week working on Pear projects over the course of 6 months

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience building internal tools, automation workflows, or founder resources.

  • Familiarity with React, Python, and/or APIs.

  • A knack for product thinking — designing with the end user in mind.

What You’ll Get Out of It

  • Direct exposure to dozens of startups across different industries.

  • The chance to ship real products that are used immediately by founders and teams.

  • Mentorship from experienced founders, engineers, and operators.

  • A front-row seat to the earliest stages of company building.

jobs.title: Founding Product Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Why August

August is building AGI for law. Our agents mimic a lawyers’ reasoning, research, and drafting, and our workflows already outperform lawyers in third-party evaluations. We’re targeting mid-market law firms, automating their legal work and allowing them to provide our tools directly to their clients. Some reasons to join August are:

  • Exceptional Early Traction: >4x revenue growth in the past four months.

  • Global Reach: Our clients span 4 continents and use August in multiple languages and jurisdictions

  • Frontier of Applied AI: August has access to proprietary data inaccessible to foundation model providers. We build agents to automate all challenging knowledge work.

  • Strategic investors: Backed by NEA and exceptional seed investors Pear VC and Afore Capital, August has the capital to execute

  • Competitive compensation and office in downtown Manhattan

Join August at an early stage as we scale our agents to process thousands of documents simultaneously and create outputs exceeding human-level accuracy.

Role Overview

As a Founding Product Engineer at August, you will design and scale production-grade agents that perform legal tasks with expert-level reasoning. You’ll work closely with the founders, legal experts, and product team to deploy AI systems in high-stakes workflows used by real lawyers across the globe..

What You'll Do

  • Build intuitive and optimized UI/UX using React and TypeScript for workflows that integrate reasoning LLMs and agentic architectures.

  • Zero-to-one product development: rapidly prototype, evaluate, integrate, and test new product features in close partnership with our customers and legal team.

  • Develop new AI native workflows: implement streaming, long-running tasks, procedural UX, etc. for new AI tasks, finding the balance between state-of-the-art and pragmatism.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 2+ years experience building production-quality frontend applications.

  • Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript, React, and Next.js.

  • Proven ability to create polished, intuitive user interfaces with attention to detail.

  • Comfortable working at an early stage company with ownership and rapid iteration.

jobs.title: Founding Full Stack Engineer (FE Focus) - Atrix
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Atrix, our journey began with a simple belief:
Breakthrough medicines and technologies change lives, and the people making them deserve better tools.

We often celebrate the final moment: a patient receiving a life-saving therapy or a groundbreaking treatment becoming standard of care.
But behind that moment is a complex, coordinated effort that begins years earlier.

Pharmaceutical and med device companies shoulder this responsibility every day:

  • Advancing science from lab to clinic

  • Navigating regulatory and access barriers

  • Ensuring safe, evidence-based adoption in the real world

They’re not just bringing products to market; they’re shaping the future of care.

Yet these organizations are often held back by outdated workflows and siloed data, unable to fully harness the knowledge that already exists across their teams.

Atrix was built to change that.


We exist to support the mission of those who dedicate their lives to creating and delivering innovations that impact global health.

The Role Description

You’ll be a core builder of the Atrix AI-native platform, designing and shipping features that turn complex healthcare and AI workflows into intuitive, elegant interfaces, trusted by scientific, medical, and commercial teams across top pharma companies.

From crafting thoughtful front-end UX to building robust backend systems, you’ll help bridge our AI core with real-world customer pain points, working on problems that genuinely move the needle in patient care.

We’re building a modular, agentic platform that connects to customer-approved data sources, transforms messy, unstructured data using advanced AI, and delivers structured, actionable insights that drive decisions in regulated environments.

You’ll tackle rich engineering challenges across:

  • ⚡️ Performance — We’re processing large data sets at once

  • 🔐 Security & Privacy — Customers trust us with sensitive data

  • 🧠 Explainability — AI outputs must be verifiable and traceable

  • 🧩 Composable UI/UX — Interfaces need to adapt to varied use cases, from chat to dashboards to spreadsheets

jobs.title: Founding AI Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Why August

August is building AGI for law. Our agents mimic a lawyers’ reasoning, research, and drafting, and our workflows already outperform lawyers in third-party evaluations. We’re targeting mid-market law firms, automating their legal work and allowing them to provide our tools directly to their clients. Some reasons to join August are:

  • Exceptional Early Traction: >4x revenue growth in the past four months.

  • Global Reach: Our clients span 4 continents and use August in multiple languages and jurisdictions

  • Frontier of Applied AI: August has access to proprietary data inaccessible to foundation model providers. We build agents to automate all challenging knowledge work.

  • Strategic investors: Backed by NEA and exceptional seed investors Pear VC and Afore Capital, August has the capital to execute

  • Competitive compensation and office in downtown Manhattan

Join August at an early stage as we scale our agents to process thousands of documents simultaneously and create outputs exceeding human-level accuracy.

Role Overview

As a Founding AI Engineer at August, you will design and scale production-grade agents that perform legal tasks with expert-level reasoning. You’ll work closely with the founders, legal experts, and product team to deploy AI systems in high-stakes workflows used by real lawyers across the globe.

What You’ll Do

  • Build and deploy agentic systems using Python to automate, evaluate, and scale end-to-end legal workflows

  • Zero-to-one product development: rapidly prototype, evaluate, integrate, and test new product features in close partnership with our customers and legal team.

  • Develop new AI native workflows: implement streaming, long-running tasks, procedural UX, etc. for new AI tasks, finding the balance between state-of-the-art and pragmatism.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 3+ years of experience building products on top of LLMs, either in grad school or in production environments; strong Python skills

  • Demonstrated ability to ship quickly especially in early-stage environments while building scalable enterprise software

  • Grit - experience working at early-stage startups is a plus.

  • Ideally candidates would have experience and deep understanding of how infrastructure-layer (Kubernetes, Database, OS, Cloud Storage etc) software systems work.

jobs.title: Founding Engineer - AI Frontdesk
jobs.descriptionHtml:
The Opportunity

We're building the AI layer for America's 33M SMBs. Our growth is explosive. 10x last year, 20% MoM, raised $3M seed from Pear a few months ago, 300+ businesses using us today (1000+ by year-end). We've discovered a completely overlooked path to dominate this SMB market while everyone else is fighting over enterprise deals.

Our Vision

While conventional wisdom says SMBs are challenging (low contract values, high churn), we've discovered unique growth opportunities where others weren't looking. SMBs represent half of US GDP and need AI solutions as much as enterprises do. We're making that possible.

Our early traction proves the model works - now we need the right product leader to help us scale. We started with AI receptionists and quickly expanded into something far more powerful. Our platform is the SMB Customer Revenue Engine - AI agents handling all conversations, an intelligence layer learning from every interaction, and outbound AI driving real revenue growth. Our vision is bold: to become the SMB super app—a single, intelligent platform that manages everything for SMBs, from customer acquisition to retention.

What You’ll Do

You’ll be our first full-stack founding engineer, with an outsized role in how the product evolves. This is not a typical engineering role. You’ll write code, yes—but also:

  • Talk to customers

  • Jump on big deals

  • Unblock growth experiments

  • Influence the roadmap directly

You’ll own features end-to-end, from prototype to scaling in prod. You’ll pair closely with the founder (ex-Meta) and PM (ex-Microsoft) to shape the company.

In your first 90 days, you’ll:

  • Ship revenue-generating features used by hundreds of SMBs

  • Sit in on sales and support calls, and turn feedback into fast product iterations

  • Work across the stack (we’re on TypeScript, React, FastAPI, Postgres, Twilio, LiveKit)

  • Patch critical AI logic that makes or breaks call quality

  • Build internal tools that unlock GTM speed

In 6 months, you’ll:

  • Own large product surface areas (e.g., lead capture workflows, analytics, integrations)

  • Drive adoption of your features across 1000+ businesses

  • Help land big deals by jumping on customer calls or prototyping something fast

  • Mentor new hires and shape engineering culture

In 12 months, you’ll:

  • Architect key parts of our system

  • Be known by name to our biggest customers

  • Help close seven-figure deals with your product insights

  • Shape hiring, process, and velocity as we scale

Who We Want

  • 2–5 years experience in fast-moving product engineering teams

  • Strong full-stack skills with experience shipping in production

  • Obsessive about customer needs—not just abstract “users”

  • Comfortable debugging, writing tests, talking to customers, and jumping on a Zoom demo—all in one day

  • Strong communicator—can pair with PMs, designers, and sales

  • NYC-based or willing to relocate (we work in-person out of a WeWork)

Bonus

  • Experience with AI, Twilio, or voice/video APIs

  • Built tools for SMBs before (e.g., think Shopify, ServiceTitan, GoHighLevel)

  • Can hold your own in a sales conversation or onboarding call

Compensation

  • Competitive salary & benefits

  • Generous equity

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Company-paid lunch/dinner in office

Our Team You’ll join the founder (ex-Meta) and product lead (ex-Microsoft) in New York as one of the first on the ground—with plans to grow this hub to five in NYC in the next quarter. It’s early, high-impact, and you’ll help shape the future of the team.

The rest of the company—12 people across engineering and customer success—is remote. Product and growth all run through NYC.

We're located in the NYC and backed by leading investors like Pear Ventures, who were also the first checks into Doordash and Gusto.

You’ll join a scrappy, ambitious team where product, engineering, and GTM run through the same room. It’s early, it’s fast, and it’s yours to shape.

jobs.title: Founding Engineer - Known
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Known:

Known is a stealth consumer AI startup on a mission to build our generation’s personal AI co-pilot.

An assistant that blurs the line between digital and real life, we can book anything for you while helping you forge deeper connections IRL.

We're starting with dating because it's the clearest, highest-pain-point wedge to learn who you are and rapidly expand into every facet of your social relationships.

In 10 days, our Stanford team raised a 7-figure pre-seed round not just for a “better dating app” but because this is a once-in-a-generation social data play built on understanding and trust.

We move at breakneck speed. If you aren’t shipping features faster than your coffee cools, we might not be a fit.

About the Role:

Join Known as a Founding Engineer and supercharge your career by 2–3 years in just months. You’ll be one of the first founding technical hires, working shoulder-to-shoulder with our CTO.

Career rocket fuel:

  1. You will be a top 0.01% expert in AI

You’ll architect everything from backend infrastructure, secure data pipelines, AI features/functionality, to core app development. Few roles let you move from databases to front-end in a single sprint.

  1. Master the art of building a startup from day one.

From fundraising to finding PMF, preparing for hyper-growth, and iterating on user feedback you’ll own the technical vision and learn every step that turns a prototype into magic.

  1. Own equity, drive architecture, and build your dream team.

As an early engineer, you’ll hold meaningful equity, co-define Wist’s entire tech stack, and recruit and mentor future engineers. If you want to lead a 10+ person engineering org within months, this is your fast lane.

If any of this sounds like where you want to take your career, let’s meet.

What You’ll Do:

  • Own Python (FastAPI) APIs, ML/LLM integrations, React/TypeScript front-ends, and secure data pipelines

  • Scale systems efficiently and reliably

  • Shape product & architecture alongside our CTO

Why You’re A Fit:

  • Passion for consumer-tech and/or social apps that truly delight users

  • Ship fast and fix things even faster

  • Have experience building full-stack systems spanning backend, frontend, and data infrastructure

  • Deployed ML models or integrated LLMs into real products

  • Comfortable scaling systems across performance, reliability, and infrastructure dimensions

You Must Have:

  • Education in Computer Science, Engineering or related

  • Experience in full stack software engineering with AI/ML

  • Flexible opinions on tech stack and are eager to learn quickly

Company Perks:

  • Sick office in the heart of SF (trust us, it’s jaw dropping)

  • Free lunches and bougie espresso machine in office

  • Team retreats, happy hours, and dinners

Compensation & Benefits:

  • Base salary: $90k – $120k

  • Real Equity

jobs.title: Fullstack Engineer - Fortify
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Fortify is modernizing student financing.

We're looking for a full-stack engineer who's excited about fintech, capital markets, and product to join us in opening up access to education.

About us:

Fortify helps students succeed by giving them more affordable ways to pay for their education, and then supporting them after they've graduated.

Since COVID, access to credit has collapsed, and students at all kinds of schools - from at trade schools to major universities - need financing options to afford their tuition. Fortify exists to help educational institutions run these financing programs more effectively, handling everything from financial aid and scholarships to payment plans and institutional loans. We make student financing simple - but we also go beyond financing, to help our students be successful after they've graduated.

We're building for those who have the ambition, motivation, and wherewithal to go to school, but are lacking the resources.

Fortify is backed by Pear VC. We're a small, very well-capitalized company.

You'll be joining a small team with a lot of expertise in fintech and lending: Both of our cofounders are second-time founders, having started two separate venture-backed companies in the space, and one was an early hire at SoFi.

About this role:

  • You'll be a full-stack engineer building Fortify's core financing platform.

  • You'll be given significant autonomy over new products and will own major launches.

  • You'll work on a very small team, and have lots of opportunities to own design & product work if you like.

  • You'll help fulfill our mission of expanding access to education and promoting economic mobility.

What you might work on:

  • Owning the architecture and launch of an entire new product, such as a financial aid tool to help students more easily apply for federal aid (FAFSA) or state aid.

  • Working on our online financing application for students who need loans, scholarships, or aid to make their experience smoother.

  • Building tools to help promote financial literacy for our students or to help them find job opportunities more easily after they graduate.

Nice-to-haves:

  • You have had significant ownership over production code at a tech startup.

  • You have outstanding written communication skills and enjoy product work as well as coding.

  • You're excited about fintech and working on critical code that processes and moves money.

  • You have experience with our tech stack: React, Python, and Postgres.

Growing at Fortify:

If you're interested in fintech, this is a unique opportunity to learn about lending, capital markets, and payment processing.

As always, there's lots of early-stage flexibility to create your own role and define what you'd like to work on. There will be lots of opportunity for you to own major new products, make key design decisions, to interview users & customers, and to grow into other areas of the business as we scale up rapidly.

Drawing on their experiences as tech leads at Snowflake and Lyft, they founded NomadicML to solve a critical industry challenge: elevate critical operations of video-ingesting enterprises with domain-specific semantic reasoning.

At NomadicML, we leverage advanced techniques, such as retrieval-augmented generation, adaptive fine-tuning, and compute-accelerated inference, to significantly improve machine learning models in the domain of real-time video understanding. Backed by leading investors and enterprises (such as Pear VC, BAG VC, Confluent and Cognition AI), we’re committed to building cutting-edge infrastructure that helps teams realize the full potential of their video insights.

About the Role:

As a Founding Machine Learning Engineer, you will shape the next generation of semantic video reasoning AI agents, blending cutting-edge research with practical implementation. You’ll design, implement, and refine Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines, enabling our models to adapt in real-time to changing data and user needs. This will involve working with text, video, and other high-dimensional inputs, as well as exploring advanced embeddings, vector databases, and GPU-accelerated infrastructures. You’ll apply statistical rigor—using significance testing, distributional checks, and other quantitative methods—to determine precisely when and how to retune models, ensuring that updates are timely yet never arbitrary.

Beyond the core ML tasks, you’ll also be a key contributor to our research initiatives. You’ll evaluate and experiment with new model architectures, foundational models, and emerging techniques in large-scale machine learning and optimization. As part of the full-stack experience, you’ll work closely with the other team members to build intuitive front-end interfaces, dashboards, and APIs. These tools will enable rapid iteration, real-time monitoring, and easy configuration of models and pipelines, making it possible for both technical and non-technical stakeholders to guide model evolution effectively.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Research, prototype, and integrate new model architectures and foundational models into our pipeline.

  • Develop and maintain real-time RAG workflows, ensuring efficient adaptation to new text, video, and streaming data sources.

  • Implement statistical methods to determine when models need retuning, leveraging metrics, significance tests, and distributional analyses.

  • Collaborate with Software Engineers to build front-end interfaces and dashboards for monitoring performance and triggering model updates.

  • Continuously refine embeddings, vector databases, and model architectures to drive improved accuracy, latency, and stability.

Must Haves:

  • Strong Proficiency in Python 

  • Deep understanding of ML model development (e.g., LLMs, embedding techniques)

  • Experience with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines, fine tuning APIs, and similar ML workflows.

  • Strong statistical background for evaluating model performance 

Nice to Haves:

  • Proficiency in frameworks like PyTorch or TensorFlow

  • Knowledge of vector databases, embedding stores, and scalable ML serving platforms

  • Experience with CI/CD tools and ML workflow management (MLflow, Kubeflow)

  • Prior research background (publications, patents) in ML, especially in foundational models or large-scale adaptation techniques

What We Offer:

  • Competitive compensation and equity

  • Apple Equipment

  • Health, dental, and vision insurance.

  • Opportunity to build foundational machine learning infrastructure from scratch and influence the product’s technical trajectory.

  • Primarily in-person at our San Francisco office with hybrid flexibility.

jobs.title: Founding Engineer - Anchor AI
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the job

Global trade still runs on outdated, time-consuming manual workflows. We’re fixing that! Anchor AI is building AI agents for customs brokers. Our AI works alongside humans to help brokers process more shipments- faster, with fewer errors.

We’re growing fast, backed by First Round Capital (early investors in Flexport), Pear VC, and other top investors. The timing is perfect: with the changes from the current administration, the market is waking up to the potential of AI. We’re racing to be the default AI platform for them.

About Us

We’re a deeply technical founding team from Google, LinkedIn, and AI research labs—backed by top-tier investors. We’re building tools logistics professionals wish they had: turning messy, fragmented data into powerful insights and automated systems.
The space is massive. The need is urgent. We’re moving fast.

The Role: Build the Foundation

As a Founding Engineer, you’ll shape both our product and technology from the ground up. You’ll help define system architecture, inform product direction, and ship features that deliver real value—fast.
This is a high-leverage role for someone who enjoys full ownership, moves quickly, and builds with purpose.

What You’ll Do

  • Design and build AI-powered logistics solutions end-to-end.

  • Develop across the stack: from polished, intuitive front-ends to scalable, reliable back-ends.

  • Own core systems and features from design to deployment.

  • Collaborate directly with the founding team and early users to shape the roadmap.

  • Drive engineering excellence, velocity, and real-world impact.

Who You Are

  • High-Agency & Impact-Oriented – You take initiative, prioritize user value, and move with urgency.

  • Product-Focused – You think beyond code to what truly matters: outcomes and experience.

  • Clear Communicator & Team Player – You thrive in fast-paced, collaborative environments.

  • Full-Stack Fluent – You’re comfortable building with Next.js, Python (FastAPI), and deploying on GCP. You know where to go deep and when to move fast.

  • Eye for Great Front-End – You care about clean interfaces, intuitive flows, and seamless interactions.

  • AI-Literate – You’ve worked with LLMs in production or used them to accelerate your own work.

  • Experienced – 2+ years in high-impact roles with a track record of ownership and execution.

Nice to Have

Background in logistics, supply chain, or related industries.

What We Offer

  • Founding Equity – A meaningful stake in what you help build.

  • Top-Tier Compensation – Competitive salary to attract and retain top talent.

  • Comprehensive Benefits + DTO – High-quality health coverage and Discretionary Time Off.

  • Onsite Collaboration – Work in-person in San Francisco for rapid iteration and deep connection.

  • Growth & Mentorship – Build alongside experienced founders who care deeply about craft.

  • The 0→1 Experience – Help define not just a product, but a category—and have fun doing it.
